entry.title: Set a float value for Xib constraint
entry.content:
as we all knows, it is impossible that setting a float value for autoLayout constraint in Xib interfaceBuilder, such as set 0.5 for a UIView‚Äôs height

There are 2 solutions to break it out

  • Method 01: get its constraint IBOutlet and modify with animation
  • Method 02: trick way!

1.open your xib as souceCode

2.find your target view‚Äôs constraint and modify it

3.save and reopen it as interface builder document

4.see what happen! üéâüéâ

entry.title: Build a custom xib class in Swift
entry.content:
First check, if you have your class name declared in the view itself, not in the file owner.

If not, do it. Then try it again.

Another option is to create IBOutlet in your AddProgramView.swift

and remove the class name from the view and add it to File‚Äôs Owner.

Connect contentView by right-clicking at the File‚Äôs owner:

Then create init methods like this:

And now you can use the AddProgramView wherever you want. Either by init(frame:)

done

entry.title: log json with pretty & unescape character string
entry.content:
In swift 2.+, printing json object in Xcode debug console window will show the escape special character string, and it is difficult to read.
so this is a func for printing pretty & unescape character string

Notice

there is a dependency lib named Logger, which will be release in my github

entry.title: commit to cocoapods
entry.content:
you must register a cocoapods account before push your pod lib „ÄÇ
prepare yourÔºö

  • email : abc@abc.com
  • username: abc
  • description: I am description

use your real custom info

now register it

check your email and activate account then use pod trunk me

if register successfully it will show:

then tag and push tag

if you use it viagithub
you can:

replace it with your real pod library

or use:

and modify the podspec configuration

the summary and description should be different or it will show warning message

then commit your podspec

and lint your podspec is valid

modify your podspec if it didn‚Äôt pass the lint

if pass it will show:

trunk push your podspec at last

it will show below when push successfully

now enjoy your own cocoapod pod!
entry.summary:
